title: Kansas City Bomber (song)
content:
{{Infobox Single | Name = Kansas City Bomber | Cover = Kansas City Bomber single.jpg | Cover size = | Border = | Caption = Promotional copy of "Kansas City Bomber" | Artist = [[Phil Ochs]] | Album = | A-side = | B-side = Gas Station Women | Released = 1973 | Format = [[Vinyl record|Vinyl]] | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = 2:26 | Label = [[A&M Records|A&M]] | Writer = Phil Ochs | Producer = Phil Ochs, [[Michael Ochs]], Lee Housekeeper | Audio sample? = | Certification = | Last single = "[[One Way Ticket Home]]"
1972 | This single = "'''Kansas City Bomber'''"
1973 | Next single = "[[Bwatue]]"
1973 | Misc = }} "'''Kansas City Bomber'''" is a song by [[Phil Ochs]], a [[United States|U.S.]] [[singer-songwriter]] best known for the [[protest song]]s he wrote in the 1960s. In 1972, record producer Lee Housekeeper asked Ochs to write the theme song for the film ''[[Kansas City Bomber]]'', a film about [[roller derby]] starring [[Raquel Welch]]. Although Ochs enjoyed watching the sport on television, composing the song proved difficult, as Ochs was suffering from [[writer's block]].{{cite book |last=Eliot |first=Marc |title=Death of a Rebel: A Biography of Phil Ochs |origyear=1979 |year=1989 |publisher=Franklin Watts |location=New York |isbn=0-531-15111-5 |pages=209–210 }}{{cite book |last=Schumacher |first=Michael |title=There But for Fortune: The Life of Phil Ochs |year=1996 |publisher=Hyperion |location=New York |isbn=0-7868-6084-7 |pages=263–264 }} At last, he made a [[demo (music)|demo]], on which [[Micky Dolenz]] of [[The Monkees]] sang back-up vocals.{{cite book |last=Cohen |first=David |title=Phil Ochs: A Bio-Bibliography |year=1999 |publisher=Greenwood Press |location=Westport, Conn. |isbn=0-313-31029-7 |page=32 }} Months later, Ochs was traveling in Australia. Housekeeper told him the film's producers liked his demo, but it was not exactly what they were looking for. Ochs decided to make a new recording of the song, backed by the Australian rock band [[Daddy Cool (band)|Daddy Cool]].Cohen, p. 33.Schumacher, p. 267. Ultimately, the film's producers chose not to use the Ochs song in the soundtrack. Nevertheless, he convinced his record company, [[A&M Records]], to release it as a [[Single (music)|single]]. The record sold poorly.Schumacher, pp. 269, 271. In the only known review of "Kansas City Bomber", ''[[Record World]]'' wrote that "progressives will find this a moody change of pace."{{cite news |title=Phil Ochs: Kansas City Bomber |newspaper=[[Record World]] |date=October 7, 1972 |page=10 }} Quoted at Cohen, p. 117. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' included the single in its "Also Recommended" column.{{cite news |title=Also Recommended |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=-A4EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA20 |newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=October 7, 1972 |page=20 |accessdate=June 21, 2010 }} In 2001, writer Mark Brend described "Kansas City Bomber" as "unremarkable".{{cite book |last=Brend |first=Mark |title=American Troubadours: Groundbreaking Singer-Songwriters of the 60s |year=2001 |publisher=Backbeat Books |location=San Francisco |isbn=0-87930-641-6 |page=109 |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=4oVAHxwYZx8C&pg=PA109 }} Biographer Michael Schumacher wrote in 1996 that the song "was neither an admirable work nor an embarrassment".Schumacher, p. 263. Many Ochs fans never heard "Kansas City Bomber" before it was included in 1988's ''[[The War Is Over: The Best of Phil Ochs]]''. The song was also included in the 1997 collection ''[[American Troubadour]]''. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Phil Ochs}} [[Category:1973 singles]] [[Category:Phil Ochs songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Phil Ochs]]

The project's content policies require that all articles be written from a [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|neutral point of view]], and not introduce bias or give undue weight to viewpoints. Please bear this in mind when making edits such as your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arecaceae?diff=383448871 recent edit] to [[:Arecaceae]]. You may also wish to read the [[Wikipedia:Introduction|introduction to editing]]. Thank you. '''''[[User:DARTH SIDIOUS 2|DARTH SIDIOUS 2]]''''' ([[User talk:DARTH SIDIOUS 2|Contact]]) 13:21, 7 September 2010 (UTC)

title: User talk:Set the record right
content:
Use of my Talk page is not advised.

[[File:Ambox notice.svg|link=|25px|alt=Information icon]] There is currently a discussion at [[Wikipedia:Administrators' noticeboard/Incidents]] regarding an issue with which you may have been involved.   <!--Template:ANI-notice--> Thank you. Providing this per process on that page, regardless of your comment above. I don't recommend semi-protecting the page, nor am I looking for sanctions - just good behavior and accountability. [[User:JoeSperrazza|JoeSperrazza]] ([[User talk:JoeSperrazza|talk]]) 15:31, 9 April 2015 (UTC)
